text:
If I try to specify "margin-left" property for table the output is invalid.
Content in table cells is shifted and it seems that difference is identical to
margin length. 
It seems that margin-left property is inherited (just assumption) but according
to XSL-FO spec. it is not inheritable.
Actually, I try to implement horizontal alignment of tables.
creator: iistomin@ciklum.net
iistomin@ciklum.net
text:
Created attachment 18519
XSL-FO input file producing the invalid output

The sample of XSL-FO file having table with specified "margin-left",
"margin-right" properties.

creator: jeremias@apache.org
text:
You were actually quite close. The problem is that you're using margin-left AND
start-indent. These two properties are corresponding properties and are
therefore mutually exclusive. If you remove the margin-left/right property and
leave the start/end-indent="0mm" everything should work as you expect.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 39881 ***

creator: gadams@apache.org
text: batch transition to closed remaining pre-FOP1.0 resolved bugs
